title: Wow how horrible
comment: 1st I went to the directory where I knew where the files I was searching for was.Then it turned up nothing. Finally I added.html &.jpg to file extensions to search for, and still nothing it said 'finished' but still nothing.Why doesnt this app work..no wonder its only 300kb big if it cant find anything.Edit: Just tryed it again but this time to search for a .gif I knew was in a folder.It still turned up nothing.Why cant it find any files?Or search within html files to find references to .gif or .jpg images?

comment: Wild card support and multi-word search would be great!

title: Outstanding
comment: Programs like this give hope to Android and smart phones of the potential to function like a real desktop computer...

comment: Pretty impressive app,allows me to grep files on the bus without having to break out the laptop. (Yes I have to do this more then any body believes) :)

title: Buggy
comment: Searching for some characters (such as \)  causes the app to instantly crash. Little buggy,  but appears to work OK.
Great tool

title: This application has a major problem
comment: This application has a major problem: it does not find the word you are searching for, if that word is in the file-name..!!! Example:  suppose you have a folder containing hundreds of text files. you are searching for some word, say:  xyz. If xyz is in the body of some file, it will be found and displayed correctly. But if xyz is in the file-name of that  file, it will not be shown..!! I understand a search tool should find all occurrences of the target word, both in the file-body and in the file-name.. Please adjust and I'll give you five stars.. Thanks
it does not allow you to simply write the search path,  you need to browse to it,  and i could not browse to the whole device including the external sd card.

comment: Thank you!

title: Powerful, excellent dev support
comment: This app makes learning RegEx worthwhile. Deceptively simple looking gui implements elegant & very powerful text search function. ..and it's fast.

title: So great.
comment: An essential app if you use actual words. Even better if you use structured text data and regular expressions.

title: No Permissions
comment: Nice to have a useful, Noninvasive App. Thanks to developer.

title: Straight forward
comment: It is often the seemingly simple apps that are the most useful on a day to day basis. As a consultant I frequently need to look up material sizes, specifications etc. This is generally the quickest way of doing it- just paste all your tables/ data into various text files & use this to fish out what you need.

title: Awesome app
comment: Great when you need to find something.
Excellent

title: Super
comment: I have to search a folder of huge txt files for keywords in a url link, then copy that link. Option: Set Intent w line number was critical. Agrep finds my url, a long press opens the file in Jota at the line number: I can then copy the url (which you can't do in agrep as it is not a text editor). Well done author of Jota !

title: Superb!
comment: Recommended by equally superb companion app JOTA & JOTA+ PEACE
So cool that they put in egrep style multiple regexp searching.  Very useful.  I have a large working set of notes, lists and source files and this nails it.  Thanks.

comment: Great app!
Excellent app for searching for text in files.

title: Great

title: aGrep: aGreat app.
comment: aGrep is aGreat app....   it fills in one big lacking feature on my Droid phone -- multi-file search. This is pretty much what I've been looking for.  Before aGrep, I had to search text files one-by-one.  aGrep automatically searches a file list and shows all matches.

title: Excellent
comment: Really good !! A must if you have a lot of data on your mobile !

title: Awesome
comment: It does exactly what I wanted it to do....  Search string/text/word written inside the text file and return the containing file. Superb..... Devs, u people ROCK! keep up the good work Cheers :-)

title: You are pro aquamarine
comment: You are pro aquamarine,

title: Grep works, highlights hits in source
comment: Android 4.1 JB Galaxy Note 2 and agrep returns expected results from a txt file on either sdcard0 or extSdCard.  Agrep finds hits AND if you press on a hit  agrep will open the input file and position to the highlighted grep string.

title: Maximum white background
comment: Can you allow changing the background color?  It's uncomfortable after long on this OLED screen.

title: Works very well
comment: Love the copy-to-clipboard feature - so convenient!  In case you're not aware of this feature, just tap on the line that you want to copy to trigger it. :)

title: Good
comment: But ...this year is 2012, not 2011...

title: Great Program
comment: Couldn't use Android seriously without it.

title: Great app
comment: Knowing some regex syntax really makes this app shine.

title: 1.5 MB text file with 2 occurrences grepped fast!
comment: I had a 1.5 MB network traffic trace that was choking my Android text editors when trying to do simple searches.   downloaded this app and literally within seconds had grepped out the 2 lines of importance to me... even better and to my joyous surprise was that selecting either grepped item took me into the text file and allowed me to look in context with grep term highlighted.   Simple, clean, fast and intuitive!

title: After finding, then what?
comment: It works to find a document (eg, a pdf), but it's useless, because then when I tap to open the item, it opens it as a huge text file full of gibberish, instead of letting the correct default program (eg, Adobe Reader) open it.

title: Better than grep!
comment: This little search utility is a handy grep-like program for your phone.  In some ways, the regex supported is more advanced than grep, for instance, I was able to do lookaheads - (?=EXP) that you can't do in grep, presumably because this uses java regular expressions instead of POSIX regular expressions.  I give it 5 stars because it is really quite useful, but I do have one little suggestion: while I do like the mode of searching in specific folders and with specific file extensions, sometimes I want to search only a single file, even if there are other files with the same extension in that folder.  So, being able to specify only certain files (instead of which folders/extensions) would be useful in addition to the search mode that already exists.
Works well :)

title: So FIne
comment: I wrote a perl program like aGrep called igrep.  I use igrep on Mac, PCs, and Linux, but have searched and searched for a handheld app with igrep functionality.  THIS IS IT!  I use aGrep (and igrep) as a personal information manager, and could not live without it.  My thanks to the developer!  Dropbox interface would be a nice enhancement.  (For now, I use FolderSync Lite.)

title: thank you!
comment: this is just what i needed!! i have a directory full of html files, each one corresponding to a bus stop in my city. with this app, i can search through all the files to find the name of a cross street within the file. this program has a good, simple, easy interface. this program has a text reader built into it. Click a result, it will open in the text viewer. When you are in the text viewer, click the menu button, and you can view the file in any other installed app that is able to view the filetype.

title: Best search app EVER!
comment: Words cannot describe how much I love aGrep.  I've been looking for an app like this for a long time.  This one searches multiple text files and is FAST, complete, and thorough.  If you have text files and you need to do keyword searching, you need this.  Text editor apps all seem to struggle with searching; this app is built for it.

title: Great app
comment: Just what I needed!
Great! Thanks for these apps

title: Excellent utility!
comment: I have a couple "ideas" I'd like to throw at you, though.  What are the chances of enabling it to search LAN connections (e.g., as ES File Explorer enables wireless connection with PC)?  In other words, enabling it to search my PC from my phone.  Also, can you incorporate an ability to search djv/djvu files?  (Motorola Atrix 4G)
